title: Slow Typophile website
content: Is it just on my side, but Typophile is extremely slow these days?
author: sim

comments.content: Has been here too (Netherlands) for the last week or so. Time outs occur a lot. Takes the fun out of being here.
Over two weeks from now. Nobody else has that problem?
Over two weeks from now. Nobody else has that problem?
Everybode else, I think. It's just so slow replying that no major discussion thread has sprung up.
Not as slow now. Seemed to have cleared up today (as in ‘the cloud of Chinese spam locusts has taken of and left the devastated scene’).
Oh my god, it's working properly again! No more lost posts!

Yes. Still too slow now.  
I'd check the engine / database.
Slower than a sloth trying to cross the Sahara..... painfully slow!

Slower than a sloth trying to cross the Sahara..... painfully slow!

It constantly crashes saying:-  
Service Temporarily Unavailable  
The server is temporarily unable to service your request due to maintenance downtime or capacity problems. Please try again later.  
Apache Server at typophile.com Port 80

Or  
Internal Server Error  
The server encountered an internal error or misconfiguration and was unable to complete your request.  
Please contact the server administrator, [itadmin@punchcut.com](mailto:itadmin@punchcut.com) and inform them of the time the error occurred, and anything you might have done that may have caused the error.  
More information about this error may be available in the server error log.  
Apache Server at typophile.com Port 80

Hamburg, Germany 8.58 local time – instant access to the following thread:

> In reply to "Dez Petranian" just released by Dezcom:
> 
> @quadbloc: Thanks for the kind words.  
> Why Armenian?
> 
> @Bill, Thanks! I hope it sells, too ;-)

Hamburg, Germany 9.00 local time – slow access to the ‘slow typophile website’ thread.  
Login results in

> Internal Server Error

Going back one step in history through Safari browser leads ‘back’ to the ‘slow typophile thread’ which shows a completed login.

Yesterday, the 4th of November Typophile was slow / not responding as well.

edit:  
It took Typophile about three minute to show me that I actually posted this comment.
Posting the edit above took about 10 seconds …
Posting the edited comment above (which originally was a double post) took 45 seconds …
Nearly a month since the last post, just wanted to add that I've been experiencing this issue as well for the past few months, though it seems to have improved somewhat.
Seems to be fixed at this moment? Is it the same for other members?
